name: Throw like a Darts Machine
description: ## Description You are a Darts enthousiast and want to take your skills to the next level. You do not wish to become a pro player, instead you want to become a Darts Machine, always adhering to the same strategy, whether it is the optimal strategy or not. --- ## Task Given your score in a Darts game, return the preferred darts to throw in the next turn given your strategy explained below. ### Input - score: your score in a Darts game: 2 <= score <= 501. ### Output - return an array of 1 upto 3 2-ples, each 2-ple holding 2 positive integers representing the number to throw, and its section respectively. - number: 1 - 20, 25 or 50 - sections: - 1: regular section of a number, bull or bull's eye - 2: double ring (doubles value of a number) - 3: triple ring (triples value of a number) ### Example - Given a score of 98, you want to throw [[20,3],[19,2]], which means the first dart is aimed at 20 at its triple ring and the second dart is aimed at 19 at its double ring. This would result in a checkout of 20 * 3 + 19 * 2 == 98. ### Input Constraints - 500 test cases of valid scores --- ## Darts The leg of Darts is played between two players, who each take turns to throw upto three darts at the board. The starting score is 501. Each dart that hits a valid section at the board reduces the score with a corresponding value. The first player that reaches a score of 0 wins the leg. image source - There are 20 numbers, each having their own section on the board. The score for hitting the section has the value of that number. - The triple ring is the smallest ring in a section of a number. Hitting it triples the value of the number. - The double ring is the bigger, outer ring in a section of a number. Hitting it doubles the value of the number. - The bull is the green circle in the center of the board. Hitting it has a value of 25. - The bull's eye is the red circle in the center of the board. Hitting it has a value of 50. - In each turn, a player can throw one, two or three darts. Once 0 is reached, the turn and leg ends. Going below 0 defaults the turn. - The final dart that reduces the score to 0 must be thrown by either hitting the bull's eye or any double ring. Any other value defaults the turn. --- ## Strategy You are very strict about the strategy to use. It's optimal for higher scores, but very risky once a checkout is possible. You won't beat many pro players using this strategy. - if a checkout (can reach 0) is possible, you will go for it - if no checkout is possible, you'd prefer to setup yourself for a final turn; you will try to reach any of the following scores in order of priority: 40, 32, 20, 16. - if you can't setup yourself for a final turn, you want to score as heavily as you can leaving yourself at least a score of 8, or the next turn would become too risky to bust yourself. There will always be at least one option if you reach this point ### Tie-breaking rules Whenever multiple options are available in any of the previous steps, you give priority as follows: - turn with least amount of darts used - highest value rendered by first dart (value = number * section) - highest value of number of first dart - highest value rendered by second dart (value = number * section) - highest value of number of second dart - highest value rendered by third dart (value = number * section) - highest value of number of third dart --- ## Examples #### One-Dart Checkout ``` score = 40 return [[20,2]] info: aim 1 dart at double ring of 20 score = 50 return [[50,1]] info: aim 1 dart at bull's eye ``` #### Two-Dart Checkout ``` score = 80 return [[20,3],[10,2]] info: aim 1 dart at triple ring of 20 and 1 at double ring of 10 score = 101 return [[17,3],[50,1]] info: aim 1 dart at triple ring of 17 and 1 at bull's eye ``` #### Three-Dart Checkout ``` score = 149 return [[20,3],[19,3],[16,2]] info: aim 1 dart at triple ring of 20 and 1 at triple ring of 19 and 1 at double ring of 16 score = 170 return [[20,3],[20,3],[50,1]] info: aim 2 darts at triple ring of 20 and 1 at bull's eye ``` #### The Bogey Numbers ``` The Bogey Numbers are scores that don't have a checkout available, while there exist higher scores that do have a checkout available. score = 169 return [[20,3],[20,3],[9,1]] info: aim 2 darts at triple ring of 20 and 1 at 9, leaving you with a score of 40 ``` #### Setup the Final Turn ``` score = 179 return [[20,3],[20,3],[19,1]]: info: aim 2 darts at triple ring of 20 and 1 at 19, leaving you with a score of 40 ``` #### Reducing Score ``` score = 401 return [[20,3],[20,3],[20,3]] info: aim 3 darts at triple ring of 20, leaving you with a score of 221 ```
